analyzed: sbyin par bya ba'i chos med pa'am slong mo pa yang dag par slong bar byed pa ma yin pa'o //

analyzed: de gnyi g-yang med pa bzhin du phyir zlog par byed pa la skyon gnyis ston par byed pa nyid do //
translated: The fault of refusing a request when neither of these two is absent is shown in the root text.

original: sbyin par bya ba'i chos yod bzhin du sbyin par mi spro bas slong ba phyir zlog pa dang / yang dag par slong bar byed pa nye bar lhags par gyur kyang yang dag par slong bar byed pa de dag la phyir zlog par byed pa ni rigs pa ma mthong ngo //
analyzed: sbyin par bya ba'i chos yod bzhin du sbyin par mi spro bas slong ba phyir zlog pa dang / yang dag par slong bar byed pa nye bar lhags par gyur kyang yang dag par slong bar byed pa de dag la phyir zlog par byed pa ni rigs pa ma mthong ngo //
translated: It is not right to turn away a beggar who has come to ask for something, when you have something to give, and you are not willing to give it.

original: byang chub sems dpas sbyin par bya ba'i dngos po yod bzhin du slong mo pa nye bar lhags pa spong bar bzod pa ma yin te phyir spong bar byed pa ni rigs pa ma yin par mthong ba'i phyir ro //

translated: It is not right for a bodhisattva to turn away a beggar who has come to ask for something, when you have something to give.

original: yang de ci ltar sogs par 'gyur /
analyzed: yang de ci ltar sogs par 'gyur /
translated: How can it be accumulated?

original: slong ba phyir bzlog pa ma byas pa la ni sogs pa med @181b pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: slong ba phyir bzlog pa ma byas pa la ni sogs pa med @181b pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because it is not accumulated if you do not turn away a beggar.

original: phyis dus gcig tu sbyin par byed pa la yon tan ma mthong bas sogs pa'i sbyin pa las bsod nams 'du ba'i sgo lhag par ma mthong zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /

translated: Because you do not see the merit in giving at one time, after turning away a beggar, you do not see the merit in giving after accumulating.

translated: The phrase he will be one who possesses distinctive merit and so on indicates this.

original: slong ba po yang mtshungs pa rnams la khyad par yod par mthong bas bsags shing sbyin par mi bya'o //
analyzed: slong ba po yang mtshungs pa rnams la khyad par yod par mthong bas bsags shing sbyin par mi bya'o //
translated: The phrase the object to be given is the same and so on indicates that, even though the substance to be given is the same, and even though the petitioner is the same, one should not give if one sees that there is a difference.

original: byang chub sems dpa' ni slong ba po la zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ni slong ba po la zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: The phrase the bodhisattva, and so on, indicates that one should not give if one sees that there is a difference.

original: dma' ba'i sems kyis zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni bdag nyid kyi nga rgyal bcag pa ston to //
analyzed: dma' ba'i sems kyis zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni bdag nyid kyi nga rgyal bcag pa ston to //
translated: The phrase with a humble mind and so on indicates that one should destroy one's pride.

original: mi brten pa'i sbyin pa'i bsdus pa'i don ni tshe 'di'i grags pa la mi brten pa ste /
analyzed: mi brten pa'i sbyin pa'i bsdus pa'i don ni tshe 'di'i grags pa la mi brten pa ste /
translated: The phrase his generosity is not dependent indicates that he does not depend on the fame of his generosity in this life.

original: de ni rtog pa tsam gyis bdag nyid smad pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni rtog pa tsam gyis bdag nyid smad pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: For that is merely a matter of speculation, and it is a matter of shame for him.

original: zhum pa med pa dus gsum du spros pa dang bcas pa'o //
analyzed: zhum pa med pa dus gsum du spros pa dang bcas pa'o //
translated: The phrase he is not discouraged indicates that he is not discouraged in the three times.

original: ngan pa ma yin pa'i sbyin pa ni bdag la yod pa'i mchog ster ba'o //
analyzed: ngan pa ma yin pa'i sbyin pa ni bdag la yod pa'i mchog ster ba'o //
translated: The generosity of the good is the bestowal of what is excellent that one possesses.

original: rgyab kyis phyogs pa med pa'i sbyin pa ni mdza' bo dang dgra la bye brag med par sbyin pa gtong bar byed pa ste /
analyzed: rgyab kyis phyogs pa med pa'i sbyin pa ni mdza' bo dang dgra la bye brag med par sbyin pa gtong bar byed pa ste /
translated: The generosity of the disinterested is the bestowal of gifts without making distinctions between friends and enemies.

original: snying rje dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: snying rje dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because it is imbued with compassion.

original: lam la mi lta ba'i sbyin pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: lam la mi lta ba'i sbyin pa gang zhe na /

original: pha rol gyis slar bdag la lan byas su mi re ba ste /
analyzed: pha rol gyis slar bdag la lan byas su mi re ba ste /
translated: It is the bestowal of gifts without expectation of reciprocation from others.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: snying brtse ba dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: snying brtse ba dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is because it is imbued with disinterestedness.üîΩWhat is generosity without regard for the ripening of the results of the act of giving?

original: phan 'dogs su re ba med ces bya ba ni phan gdags pa nyid kyi rgyu mthong ba ste /

original: bde ba 'dod pa sred pa'i mes bsregs par gyur pa rnams mthu med pa mthong ba'i phyir ro //

original: bde ba'i rgyu 'dod pas 'jug pa rnams la yang phan pa dang / snying brtse ba'i sems kyis de'i ched du bstan par bya ba'i phyir gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: bde ba'i rgyu 'dod pas 'jug pa rnams la yang phan pa dang / snying brtse ba'i sems kyis de'i ched du bstan par bya ba'i phyir gsungs pa ni /
translated: It is because it is imbued with the knowledge of the insubstantiality of the individual and of the insubstantiality of the thing.

analyzed: skye bo rang bzhin gyis sdug bsngal ba dag mthong ba'i phyir zhes bya ba'o // phyi ma la longs spyod phun sum tshogs pa'am /
translated: because he sees that people are naturally miserable.

original: rnam par smin pa la re ba med ces bya ba 'di la /
analyzed: rnam par smin pa la re ba med ces bya ba 'di la /

original: de'i rgyu bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de'i rgyu bstan par bya ba'i phyir /

analyzed: cad snying po med par lta ba dang / de'i gnyen po nyid la phan yon du lta ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
